newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatia lending rate rises 60 bps to 11.3 pct.
newsitem.headline: Croatia lending rate rises 60 bps to 11.3 pct.

text.p: Croatia's average lending rate rose 60 basis points to 11.3 percent on Tuesday after Monday's dip amid high liquidity.
Trade shrank to 20.3 from 31.8 million kuna. Supply was put by dealers at 60 million.
Call money ended at 10.1 percent compared with 10.5 Monday.
Other interbank rates were steady, with term deals done between two-week 14 percent and 16 percent for 60-day loans.
Insurers charged 9.0 percent for one-week funds.
The kuna mid-rate for Wednesday eased slightly to 5.9890 versus the dollar but was little changed at 3.5710 to the mark. -- Kolumbina Bencevic, Zagreb Newsroom, 385-1-4557075
